London att the Angell Corner shop of fenchurch street November 18Â° 82 Madam Since your departure from Mr Jayes, (very unwilling I am to occasion this trouble of advice) your sonn Mr Nath: Hartshorne have gradually come into my Debt 15 or 20 pounds, for goods hee tooke up at our shop, which I thought necessary to acquaint you with by reason hee promised mee payment & have disappointed mee, your assistance in this business I implore, [words lost] I would not take any vigorous means to secure my debt although it lay in my power soe to doe, by reasons of t[he] small acquaintance I had of you, I shall ever acknowledge my selfe Madam Your Most obliged servant JnÂ° Medley
